group.label: Connection
group.comment: Configure your Cloudflare R2 credentials below and use "Test Connection" to verify. Once verified, R2 will appear as a Media Storage option under System > Configuration > Advanced > System > Storage Configuration for Media.

field.label: Account ID
field.comment: Your Cloudflare Account ID. Used to build the default endpoint when the endpoint field is empty.

field.label: Endpoint
field.comment: Example: https://<account-id>.r2.cloudflarestorage.com (leave empty to auto-generate from Account ID)

field.label: Region
field.comment: Use "auto" for Cloudflare R2 (default if left empty).

field.label: Bucket
field.comment: The name of your R2 bucket.

field.label: Access Key ID
field.comment: R2 API Token Access Key ID from Cloudflare dashboard.

field.label: Secret Access Key
field.comment: R2 API Token Secret Access Key from Cloudflare dashboard.

field.label: Use Path Style Endpoints
field.comment: Enable for path-style URLs (bucket in path). Default is virtual-hosted style.
Save configuration first, then test the connection. Once verified, R2 will be available as a Media Storage option.

field.label: Key Prefix
field.comment: Optional prefix for all media objects, for example: media

field.label: File Existence Cache TTL (seconds)
field.comment: How long to cache CDN file existence checks in Redis. Default: 3600 (1 hour)

group.label: Media URL Configuration
group.comment: Configure your public media URL after enabling R2 storage.

field.label: Important
field.comment: Set the Base URL for User Media Files to your R2 public domain or CDN. You can also update this under Stores > Configuration > General > Web.

field.label: Base Media URL (Unsecure)
field.comment: Example: https://media.example.com/. Leave blank to keep the Magento default (/media/).

field.label: Base Media URL (Secure)
field.comment: Example: https://media.example.com/. Leave blank to keep the Magento default (/media/).
